channel.title: Will bots die?
channel.description: Since its HTML5 will we still have bots?

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Eh nvm, I read Jacmobs post wrong, plus it was from 2010.

My bad, carry on :D.

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:21, topic:523851”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=642396.msg4329338#msg4329338 date=1373438850]

I never thought about it before but Ruby is right this could make botting even larger of an issue.

How efficient would server side detection be compared to client side detection?

Jacmob said it himself that there is no detection going on.

inb4 “omgz but meyb dats wat he wantz u 2 think!”

No.
[/quote]

I do find that hard to believe.[/quote]
Yeah there is definitely some server side detection as there are no spam bots anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:523851”]I never thought about it before but Ruby is right this could make botting even larger of an issue.

How efficient would server side detection be compared to client side detection?[/quote]They never did client side “detection”, they just tried to prevent people from writing bots by obscuring the client code. Server side detection is looking for patterns and things like that. Obviously they’re still obfuscating and minifying their client, but I don’t think that’s their main goal right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“The Enforcer, post:16, topic:523851”]I bot server-side with my kernel-mode rootkit. Very efficient. Good investment. Access to Jagex servers anytime. However, it was a bit annoying. Their servers run on iPads so I had to familiarize myself with iOS a bit. The core is C++ of course.[/quote]notsureifsrs

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

I bot server-side with my kernel-mode rootkit. Very efficient. Good investment. Access to Jagex servers anytime. However, it was a bit annoying. Their servers run on iPads so I had to familiarize myself with iOS a bit. The core is C++ of course.

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

badger41:

is the html 5 client still only available for members?

Yeah, it seems like it.

OT: The damn client looks and feels so weird to me, not to mention it’s so close to the character (assuming this can be tweaked through the settings though). As for botting though - won’t stop.

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:10, topic:523851”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=642396.msg4325843#msg4325843 date=1372901325]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=642396.msg4325833#msg4325833 date=1372900385]

The HTML5 client is still horribly unoptimized, I hope they fix it fast
[/quote]It’s actually not that bad, but I’m sure they could get it to be faster yet. There are more performant games in JS, but they’ve been compiled from C/C++.

I’m talking about the need to “preload” the shaders every few seconds.
[/quote]Doesn’t happen on mine. It preloads shaders on login and a few times ingame but it isn’t persistent or disruptive.[/quote]
I’m hit with it every 2 seconds, just enough to keep it playable, but cause a disruption in the smoothness

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow

The HTML5 client is still horribly unoptimized, I hope they fix it fast
[/quote]It’s actually not that bad, but I’m sure they could get it to be faster yet. There are more performant games in JS, but they’ve been compiled from C/C++.

I’m talking about the need to “preload” the shaders every few seconds.[/quote]Doesn’t happen on mine. It preloads shaders on login and a few times ingame but it isn’t persistent or disruptive.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Well we all know how bad they are at optimizing their code already. Look at the java client, it’s laggy as shit. My cousin bought a $2000 computer just so he could play it on HD, lmao[/quote]
The current client is laggy at all… You must have a shitty computer. And your friend is an idiot for spending $2,000 just to play RuneScape in HD.

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

This update has nothing to do with botting and as Ruby said it could make the problem worse. From what I’ve seen though, Jagex is focusing on server-side detection rather than client-side prevention now.

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

Ruby:

Of course, why would a HTML5 client stop botting? RS is rendered on a canvas which is a js api so it’ll probably be easier to bot. Most website developers know enough js to write a simple script like a bot script so all they’re really doing is opening the bot market to more people. Plus they’re still running the java client for bad PC’s so people can bot through that.

oh.

I run faster with HTML as far as I know

Read full topic

item.title: Will bots die?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Of course, why would a HTML5 client stop botting? RS is rendered on a canvas which is a js api so it’ll probably be easier to bot. Most website developers know enough js to write a simple script like a bot script so all they’re really doing is opening the bot market to more people. Plus they’re still running the java client for bad PC’s so people can bot through that.

Read full topic
